WAIT MAXIMIZE THE PAINT SCREEN !!![/glow]

item.title: Ultimate paint script!
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

copy+paste it into scar, making sure u deleted what is there when you open it. then open microsoft paint. drag the crosshairs to the bar at the top of the mspaint window to select the entire program. make sure the area to be painted on is as big as it needs to be to fill the screen. press ctrl+alt+r to start it. press ctrl+alt+s when u want to stop it. is that simple enough?

Read full topic

item.title: Ultimate paint script!
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

lol srry i took so long to check this again. damn thats smart. right click! smacks head how stupid could i have been? to right click u put false instead of true for the boolean in the clickmouse stuff.

heres the(supposed)finished script:

// this will seemingly run for a little while after stopped. this is because mspaint // is trying to catch up to how many times the script clicked. // the more time you leave this running, the longer it will seem to run after // being stopped. program New; var blackcolorbitmap, a, b, paintfillbitmap, c, d :integer; begin blackcolorbitmap := BitmapFromString(14, 14, 'z78DA3330A026' + '7031074183513347CD1C3573C498490B08004676E50C'); paintfillbitmap := BitmapFromString(7, 7, 'z78DA73317701420' + '30CE08224EE0606986A9CC110590DA64A643506064E6E4E6EA824' + '316A70A944568FC946F8C205C58FE86612520902005CA03F37'); if(findbitmap(paintfillbitmap, a, b))then begin clickmouse(a, b, true) end; wait(5000) if(findbitmap(blackcolorbitmap, c, d))then begin clickmouse(c, d, true) wait(10) end; repeat clickmouse(279, 423, true) wait(10) clickmouse(279, 423, false) wait(10) until(false) end.
i havnt tested it yet so tell me if there are bugs.

EDIT: it works fine on my comp, so just lengthen the waits if it doesn’t work on urs

Read full topic

item.title: Ultimate paint script!
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

it doesn’t matter. you cant make SCAR press it. the only thing you can do with that is detect it

Edit: heheheh… im stupid. keydown(17) does it. i cant remember what script i found this out from, so i cant really credit anyone without having the possibility of accidentally crediting the wrong person. i will post the version with pressing ctrl instead of right clicking later tonight. or… i would. if i could just figure out how to make it press “i”!!!(not for writeln, but for keydown)

item.title: Ultimate paint script!
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

goatee, the chr(ctrl) wont work cause thats not 1 letter :P. i abandoned that idea anyway, and am going for bootnecklad’s idea. i made a working script for it, but for some reason it never clicks blue or black. and also, it goes slow enough that you can stop it on any color you want without much trouble. here it is, could someone try to figure out why it wont click the black or blue ones? ill be sure to credit you in the finished version. program Paint_siezure_causer; //scripted by gokon, idea by bootnecklad var blackcolorbitmap, a, b, yellowcolorbitmap, c, d, greencolorbitmap, e, f, redcolorbitmap, g, h, bluecolorbitmap, i, j, whitecolorbitmap, k, l, paintfillbitmap, m, n :integer; begin blackcolorbitmap := BitmapFromString(17, 15, 'z78DA73337003' + '424B331034A02A703107413703041CB565D496515B466D191EB64' + '0C4A90B916DA13504001CB3358B'); bluecolorbitmap := BitmapFromString(1, 14, 'z78DA3330A02670' + '310741009F011012'); greencolorbitmap := BitmapFromString(14, 14, 'z78DA3330A026' + '7031074118CFCD8D1AE4A899A3668E9A3998CDA40504002F2DFDC' + 'C'); redcolorbitmap := BitmapFromString(14, 14, 'z78DA3330A02670' + '31074108DBCD8D3AE4A899A3668E9A3998CDA405040060ADFDCC'); whitecolorbitmap := BitmapFromString(14, 14, 'z78DA3330A026' + '7031074108DB8D4A60D4CC513347CD1CCC66D2020200009B2F5B'); yellowcolorbitmap := BitmapFromString(14, 14, 'z78DA3330A02' + '67031074108DB0D08A8418E9A396AE6A89983D94C5A4000496416' + '9B'); paintfillbitmap := BitmapFromString(7, 7, 'z78DA73317701420' + '30CE08224EE0606986A9CC110590DA64A643506064E6E4E6EA824' + '316A70A944568FC946F8C205C58FE86612520902005CA03F37'); repeat if(findbitmap(paintfillbitmap, a, b))then begin clickmouse(a, b, true) end; if(findbitmap(blackcolorbitmap, c, d))then begin clickmouse(c, d, true) clickmouse(202, 370, true) wait(10) end; if(findbitmap(bluecolorbitmap, e, f))then begin clickmouse(e, f, true) clickmouse(202, 370, true) wait(10) end; if(findbitmap(redcolorbitmap, g, h))then begin clickmouse(g, h, true) clickmouse(202, 370, true) wait(10) end; if(findbitmap(greencolorbitmap, i, j))then begin clickmouse(i, j, true) clickmouse(202, 370, true) wait(10) end; if(findbitmap(yellowcolorbitmap, k, l))then begin clickmouse(k, l, true) clickmouse(202, 370, true) wait(10) end; if(findbitmap(whitecolorbitmap, m, n))then begin clickmouse(m, n, true) clickmouse(202, 370, true) wait(10) end; until(false) end.
edit: i changed the script from scarscipt to code cause in scarscript some shit was appearing that i didn’t put in there and when it copy/pasted into SCAR it was still there

PeterMan:

what does this do?

[quote=“Weibs, post:3, topic:16106”]Lol, its a good thing I don’t suffer from epilipsy. ;)[/quote] this part is to only PeterMan: it makes the screen flash colors really, really fast. this part is to both PeterMan and Weibs: when a person has a condition called photosensitivity it causes seizures. epilepsy you just have random siezures

Read full topic

item.title: Ultimate paint script!
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“gokon, post:7, topic:16106”]hey, i finally got around to trying to script my idea, and i cant figure out how to make it press ctrl. i found how to detect if ctrl is down, but not how to press it. its not in the SCAR manual, so im guessing you cant, but if its possible, please tell me.
EDIT: WARNING: IF I SUCCEED WITH THIS, IT WILL CAUSE SEIZURES IN PHOTOSENSITIVE PEOPLE.[/quote]

Keydown might work … this is a tiny script… oviously wont work but its something to work on.

//Just open paint and maximize it also make the canvas really big!

Program Kill;

Procedure Seizure;
begin;
activateclient; //Do this in the procedure so they cant click out of paint :)

Keydown('i' + Chr(CTRL));
Keyup(Chr(ALT) + Chr(Delete) + Chr(F9) + 's'); //Just so they cant stop it :P

end;

Begin;
Repeat;
Seizure;
until false
end.

I hope that would work … all the Chr(w/e)s wont work but i dont have the proper code for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Ultimate paint script!
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Unc, it does work, and nice script aps. Creative :). Lol, its a good thing I don’t suffer from epilipsy.

EDIT: I was bored so I made it with more colors

var starttime:integer; begin starttime:= gettickcount; findwindow('untitled - Paint'); activateclient; getself.hide; clickmouse(-18, 41,true); repeat clickmouse(-21, 635,true); wait(1); clickmouse(450+random(250), 250+random(250),true); wait(1); clickmouse(-20, 653,true); wait(1); clickmouse(450+random(250), 250+random(250),true); wait(1); clickmouse(15, 645, true); wait(1); clickmouse(450+random(250), 250+random(250),true); wait(1); clickmouse(45, 650, true); wait(1); clickmouse(450+random(250), 250+random(250),true); wait(1); clickmouse(30, 650, true); wait(1); clickmouse(450+random(250), 250+random(250),true); wait(1); clickmouse(173, 632, true); wait(1); clickmouse(450+random(250), 250+random(250),true); wait(1); clickmouse(185, 645, true); wait(1); clickmouse(450+random(250), 250+random(250),true); wait(1); clickmouse(90, 650, true); wait(1); clickmouse(450+random(250), 250+random(250),true); wait(1); clickmouse(60, 650, true); wait(1); clickmouse(450+random(250), 250+random(250),true); wait(1); clickmouse(-20, 650, true); wait(1); clickmouse(450+random(250), 250+random(250),true); wait(1); until(isfkeydown(9)); getself.show; FindWindowTitlePart('paintscare.scar',true); activateclient; repeat movemouse(775, 707); writeln('you just got freakin OWN3D your computer is LOCKED FOREVER'); getself.show; until(gettickcount - starttime > 10000); writeln('just joking : )'); end.

Just tell me if you want me to take it off.

Read full topic
